title: How to Make Groundnut Chutney

steps.headline: Take some ground nuts.
steps.description: You may take a cup full of groundnuts.

steps.headline: Roast them in a pan until the outer cover has small black spots on it.
Take them in a pot and add a pinch of salt, a little oil, one tablespoon of red pepper, and cumin.
Add 3-4 pieces of garlic for taste.
Grind them coarsely in a grinder.
Enjoy your chutney with chapati, roti, or rice.
Roast the peanuts slightly.
steps.description: Then, add coconut to the roasted peanuts. Coconut is optional.

steps.headline: Mix all the items for grinding along with some water in a blender.
steps.description: Make it into a thick paste.

steps.headline: Transfer it to a bowl.
steps.description: Add water as per the consistency required.

steps.headline: Season.
steps.description: Heat the oil in a small pan and when hot, add the other ingredients mentioned for seasoning. When the mustard starts spluttering, remove it from the stove and add it to paste. It is ready to serve.

text: Simple Groundnut Chutney Take some ground nuts. You may take a cup full of groundnuts. Roast them in a pan until the outer cover has small black spots on it.  Take them off.  Take them in a pot and add a pinch of salt, a little oil, one tablespoon of red pepper, and cumin.  Add 3-4 pieces of garlic for taste.  Grind them coarsely in a grinder.  Enjoy your chutney with chapati, roti, or rice.  Seasoned Groundnut Chutney Roast the peanuts slightly. Then, add coconut to the roasted peanuts. Coconut is optional. Mix all the items for grinding along with some water in a blender. Make it into a thick paste. Transfer it to a bowl. Add water as per the consistency required. Season. Heat the oil in a small pan and when hot, add the other ingredients mentioned for seasoning. When the mustard starts spluttering, remove it from the stove and add it to paste. It is ready to serve.
